name: Practical Nurse
description: The IMT-Apprenticeship program at Bates Technical College offers a series of courses focused on industrial manufacturing. IMT 101 covers Industrial Manufacturing Safety, emphasizing occupational safety standards and practices. IMT 102 introduces the basics of industrial manufacturing processes and operations. IMT 103 delves into production processes, teaching students about workflow and efficiency in manufacturing. IMT 104 focuses on machine maintenance, providing skills for maintaining and troubleshooting industrial machinery. This program is designed to equip students with practical knowledge and hands-on experience for a career in industrial manufacturing.
course_prerequisites: BIO& 241 (Human Anatomy and Physiology I with lab)
BIO& 242 (Human Anatomy and Physiology II with lab)
application_requirements: Complete the Practical Nurse program application
information_session_schedules: 2nd and 4th Thursday, Monthly, 3-4 p.m. via Zoom
related_courses:
ENGL& 101 English Composition I: Focuses on developing writing skills necessary for academic success. Emphasizes clarity, coherence, and argumentation in written communication. Estimated time to completion: 1 quarter
- BIOL& 160 General Biology: Covers fundamental biological principles including cell structure, genetics, evolution, and ecology. Integrates lecture and lab experiences to reinforce scientific concepts. Estimated time to completion: 1 quarter
- BIOL& 241 Anatomy and Physiology I: Examines the structure and function of the human body, focusing on musculoskeletal, nervous, and endocrine systems, with detailed lab work. Estimated time to completion: 1 quarter
- BIOL& 242 Anatomy and Physiology II: Continues from BIOL& 241, covering cardiovascular, respiratory, digestive, urinary, and reproductive systems, with extensive lab sessions. Estimated time to completion: 1 quarter
- MATH& 146 Basic Statistics: Introduces statistical methods and analysis, focusing on practical applications and data interpretation. Estimated time to completion: 1 quarter
- PSYC& 100 General Psychology: Provides an overview of psychological principles and practices, including behavior, cognition, and emotion. Estimated time to completion: 1 quarter
- PSYC& 200 Psychology through the Lifespan: Examines psychological development from infancy through old age, covering major theories and research. Estimated time to completion: 1 quarter
- BIOL& 260 Microbiology: Studies microorganisms and their roles in health, disease, and the environment, with lab work to reinforce concepts. Estimated time to completion: 1 quarter
- CHEM& 121 Introduction to Chemistry: Introduces basic chemical principles, including atomic structure, bonding, and stoichiometry, with hands-on lab sessions. Estimated time to completion: 1 quarter
- NUTR& 101 Nutrition: Covers the principles of human nutrition, focusing on the relationship between diet, health, and disease. Estimated time to completion: 1 quarter

ENGL& 101 - English Composition I: Focuses on developing academic writing skills through essays, critical reading, and analytical thinking. Emphasizes clarity, coherence, and argumentation. Estimated time to completion: 1 quarter.
- CHEM& 121 - Introduction to Chemistry with Lab: Covers fundamental chemical principles such as atomic structure, bonding, and stoichiometry, supported by lab sessions for hands-on experience. Estimated time to completion: 1 quarter.
- BIOL& 160 - General Biology with Lab: Provides a comprehensive overview of biological principles including cell biology, genetics, evolution, and ecology. Integrates lectures and lab work. Estimated time to completion: 1 quarter.
- BIOL& 241 - Human Anatomy and Physiology I: Focuses on the musculoskeletal, nervous, and endocrine systems with extensive laboratory sessions. Estimated time to completion: 1 quarter.
- BIOL& 242 - Human Anatomy and Physiology II: Continues from BIOL& 241, covering the cardiovascular, respiratory, digestive, urinary, and reproductive systems with comprehensive lab work. Estimated time to completion: 1 quarter.
- MATH& 146 - Introduction to Statistics: Introduces key statistical concepts including probability, data analysis, and inferential statistics, focusing on practical applications. Estimated time to completion: 1 quarter.
